  • Constructor Details

    • MyServer

      public MyServer()
      The MyServer function is the constructor for the MyServer class. It initializes a boolean variable stop to false, and an ArrayList of Hosts called HostsList.

      public List<Socket> getHostsList()
      The getHostsList function returns the list of hosts that are connected to the server.
      Returns:
      A list of sockets

    • initMyServer

      public void initMyServer(int port, ClientHandler clientHandler)
      The initMyServer function initializes the server with a port and clientHandler.
      Parameters:
      port - Specify the port number on which the server will listen for incoming connections
      clientHandler - Set the clienthandler variable

    • start

      public void start()
      The start function creates a new thread and runs the runServer function on it.

    • runServer

      public void runServer() throws IOException
      The runServer function is responsible for opening a server socket on the port given in the constructor. The function then waits for clients to connect, and when they do, it passes their input and output streams to the clientHandler's handleClient method.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • handleClient

      public void handleClient(InputStream inputStream, OutputStream outputStream)
      The handleClient function is called by the server when a client connects to it. It reads objects from the client and puts them in an input queue, which can be read by calling getInput().
      Parameters:
      inputStream - Read data from the server
      outputStream - Send data to the client

    • handleRequests

      public void handleRequests()
      The handleRequests function is a function that takes in the inputQueue and handles all of the requests that are put into it. It does this by taking each request from the queue, converting it to a JsonObject, and then using its socketSource field to find out which client sent it. Then, we use our ClientHandler class's handleClient method on this client with an InputStream made from our jsonString as well as an OutputStream made from the Socket's output stream.

    • getSocket

      public Socket getSocket(String source)
      The getSocket function takes a string as an argument and returns the socket that corresponds to it.
      Parameters:
      source - Get the ip address and port number of a socket
      Returns:
      A socket object

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      The close function is used to close the server and all of its connections. It does this by setting a boolean variable, stop, to true. This will cause the while loop in run() to terminate when it next checks for stop's value. The executorService is then shutdownNow(), which causes any threads that are currently running tasks (i.e., those that have not yet terminated) to be interrupted and shut down immediately upon their termination or interruption (whichever comes first).
      Throws:
      IOException
